Articles.Content:
So, there was a mod I saw in some KSP videos a while back but I can't remember the name of it. It was like an advanced version of Procedural Tanks, where you could select different endpiece styles for various tanks and stuff, and it had much better textures with what seemed to be complex modeled geometry. Anyone know what I'm talking about? I remember it had some special integration with TUFX, if that helps.

Edited March 24, 2021 by Starseeker

49 minutes ago, Starseeker said:

So, there was a mod I saw in some KSP videos a while back but I can't remember the name of it. It was like an advanced version of Procedural Tanks, where you could select different endpiece styles for various tanks and stuff, and it had much better textures with what seemed to be complex modeled geometry. Anyone know what I'm talking about? I remember it had some special integration with TUFX, if that helps.

Sounds like SSTU (Shadow Space Technologies Unlimited). It, Textures Unlimited, and TUFX are (or were - is he still active?) developed by @Shadowmage, and SSTU has TU (not TUFX) as a dependency.

Edited March 24, 2021 by OrdinaryKerman
TU is for PBR and recolourable parts, TUFX is for camera effects.

19 minutes ago, OrdinaryKerman said:

Sounds like SSTU (Shadow Space Technologies Unlimited). It, Textures Unlimited, and TUFX are (or were - is he still active?) developed by @Shadowmage, and SSTU has TU (not TUFX) as a dependency.

Ah yep, that's exactly it!
